question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable whenever possible. I'll show you a UI interface design, and could you write the corresponding code for it?

checklist.title: Is the UI implementation faithful to the design specification?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the implementation matches the provided design with pixel-perfect accuracy. Check for proper colors, spacing, fonts, and overall visual fidelity. Score 0 if the implementation looks completely different from the design, 5 if there are several noticeable inconsistencies, and 10 if it's nearly identical to the design specification.

checklist.title: Is the HTML structure semantic and accessible?
checklist.description: Examine the HTML structure for proper semantics (using appropriate tags like nav, header, section, etc.), ARIA attributes where necessary, and keyboard navigability. Check for proper heading hierarchy, alt text for images, and form label associations. Deduct 3 points for each major accessibility issue found (missing alt text, non-semantic divs for clickable elements, etc.). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the CSS implementation clean, maintainable and responsive?
checklist.description: Check if the CSS uses a methodology (BEM, SMACSS, etc.), avoids !important, implements responsive breakpoints properly, and uses relative units where appropriate. Check for browser compatibility and if media queries are used effectively. Deduct 3 points for excessive CSS duplication, 3 points for non-responsive implementation, and 4 points for browser incompatibility issues. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the interactive functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Verify that all interactive elements work as expected: buttons trigger appropriate actions, forms validate input, dropdown menus open/close, modal dialogs function correctly, etc. Check for proper event handling and state management. Score 0 if interactive elements are purely decorative, 5 if basic functionality works but with issues, 10 if all interactions are fully functional.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty states, error handling, input validation, edge cases) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Subtle micro-interactions 2. Performance optimizations like lazy loading 3. Additional visual feedback for user actions). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions 2. Function modules unrelated to the UI design 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations or transitions). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as component-based structure), code organization, variable/function naming, and code reusability. Deduct 5 points if global CSS/JS pollutes namespace, deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%), deduct 5 points if code is not properly organized into files/folders. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
